result.execSummary:
The defendant Sacramento Sanchez-Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
State moves to amend Ct #2 to straight Disorderly conduct, dropping the domestic abuse enhancer.  Court approves.  DE pleads No Contest to amended Ct #2.  Found Guilty.  
Sentence is withheld, DE placed on 1 year of probation. Conditions:   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  No abusive contact with any family members.  $443 court costs.  Report to probation today.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sacramento Sanchez-Diaz

records.addlTxt: adversary counsel for DEF  Joseph Martell  $725.56  bill DEF

Defendant Sacramento Sanchez-Diaz in court with attorney Joseph E Martell.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court verifies with the DE that he understands the English language.  He states he can understand the verbal language, struggles with reading it however.  The court verifies that he does indeed want to proceed without an interpreter and DE states that he understands and wants to proceed with Plea.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  State moves to amend Ct #2 to straight Disorderly conduct, dropping the domestic abuse enhancer.  Court approves.  DE pleads No Contest to amended Ct #2.  Found Guilty.  
Sentence is withheld, DE placed on 1 year or probation. Conditions:   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  No abusive contact with any family members.  $443 court costs.  Report to probation today.  
Victim notification completed as per DA.
Ct #1 is dismissed but read in.

Defendant Sacramento Sanchez-Diaz in court with attorney Joseph E Martell.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
